Articles.Content:
Another forum I frequent has a good feature, it automatically locks threads that have gone 30 days without a new post. The moderators can override the lock if for some reason that is desirable.

The forum does use different software than here, but I was wondering if such a feature is available here. Would help cut down on all the necro thread revival.

It is available on these forums, but posting in an old thread is not a bad thing in itself. There are many reasons to bump an old thread, for example because it has good content, or if the topic has become relevant again. Thread bumping in itself is therefore not forbidden on the KSP forums, as long as the new post abides by the forum rules (ie: no contentless posts for example).
